IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ACADEMIC EDUCATION FOR GRADES PRE-K THROUGH 8
IRS990.MissionDesc: ACADEMIC EDUCATION FOR GRADES PRE-K THROUGH 8
IRS990.Desc: ACADEMIC EDUCATION FOR GRADES PRE-K THROUGH 8. THE ENROLLMENT FOR THE YEAR WAS APPROXIMATELY 297 STUDENTS. GRANTS ARE SCHOLARSHIP AND FINANCIAL AID AWARDS WHICH ARE APPLIED AGAINST TUITION FEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PERMANENT ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, THE LIBRARY, ARTS, FACULTY PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND OTHER SCHOOL-RELATED ITEMS.
SCHOLARSHIP, EMPLOYEE, & MINORITY GRANTS SHOWN AS A REDUCTION OF PROGRAM 691,516.
RENTAL EXPENSES SHOWN AS EXPENSE ON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 31,978.
SCHOLARSHIP, EMPLOYEE, & MINORITY GRANTS SHOWN AS A REDUCTION OF PROGRAM 691,516.
THE RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IS NOTED ON ALL PRESS RELEASES AND IS INCLUDED IN THE FORMAL APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: SCHOLARSHIP AND AID APPLIED AGAINST TUITION FEES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANTS AND ALLOCATIONS:SCHOLARSHIP APPLICANTS MUST COMPLETE THE ADMISSIONS APPLICATION PROCESS INCLUDING SUBMISSION OF ACADEMIC TRANSCRIPTS, A LETTER OF REFERRAL, ADMISSIONS TESTING, AND BE CONSIDERED A MISSION APPROPRIATE STUDENT BY THE ADMISSIONS COMMITTEE. THERE IS AN ADDITIONAL SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION PROCESS. SCHOLARSHIP CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED IF FURTHER INFORMATION IS REQUIRED. PER IRS INSTRUCTION: COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES, AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS AND AGENCIES SUBJECT TO THE FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (20 U.S.C. 2343G) ARE NOT REQUIRED TO LIST THE NAMES OF INDIVIDUALS WHO WERE PROVIDED SCHOLARSHIPS OR OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WHERE SUCH DISCLOSURE WOULD VIOLATE THE PRIVACY PROVISIONS OF THE LAW. THE HARFORD DAY SCHOOL IS SUBJECT TO THE FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHT AND PRIVACY ACT AND, THEREFORE, HAS NOT DISCLOSED A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF GRANTS AND OTHER FINANCIAL AID.

FOLLOWING ARE THE HARFORD DAY SCHOOL(HDS) PRINCIPLES WHICH UNDERLIE THE GRANTING OF FINANCIAL AID: - HDS IS COMMITTED TO HAVING A STUDENT BODY WHICH IS SOCIO-ECONOMICALLY DIVERSE. THE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM IS A MEANS TOWARD ACHIEVING THAT END. WE GENERALLY DO NOT AWARD FULL TUITION AID. OUR GRANTS ARE FUNDED THROUGH A SMALL SCHOLARSHIP ENDOWMENT AND THE GENEROSITY OF CONTRIBUTORS, BUT FUNDING IS LIMITED. - ASSISTANCE FOR ANY STUDENT IN GOOD STANDING, CURRENT OR NEW, IS BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED. YOU MUST RE-APPLY EACH YEAR THAT YOU REQUEST AID. - PRIORITY IS GIVEN FIRST TO ELIGIBLE FAMILIES CURRENTLY RECEIVING AID WHO CONTINUE TO DEMONSTRATE NEED, SECOND TO OTHER CURRENT FAMILIES AND THIRD TO FAMILIES NEW TO HDS. - FINANCIAL NEED IS THE GREATEST DETERMINANT OF AWARDS. REPORTS FROM SSS PROVIDE GENERAL DIRECTION TO THE HDS FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE BUT ARE NOT THE SOLE BASIS FOR DETERMINING AWARDS. -THERE ARE NO SPECIFIC INCOME CUT-OFFS TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY. IN KEEPING WITH THE SCHOOL'S PHILOSOPHICAL EMPHASIS UPON MEETING INDIVIDUAL NEEDS IN ALL AREAS, WE CONSIDER THE FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES OF EACH APPLICANT INDIVIDUALLY. -ALL INFORMATION ON YOUR FINANCIAL AID FORMS WILL BE HELD IN STRICTEST CONFIDENCE. IT IS AVAILABLE ONLY TO SSS AND A SMALL HDS FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE. -FINANCIAL AID IS GRANTED WITH THE UNDERSTANDING THAT IF YOUR ABILITY TO PAY TUITION IMPROVES AFTER AID HAS BEEN GRANTED, YOU WILL NOTIFY HDS AND ASSUME YOUR RESPONSIBILITY FOR A GREATER PART OF TUITION. -HDS DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF COLOR, CREED, RELIGION, NATIONAL ORIGIN, SEXUAL ORIENTATION OR DISABILITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE TREASURER AND FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE FORM 990 BEFORE IT IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION SENDS OUT THEIR CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ANNUALLY AND ASKS EVERY BOARD MEMBER TO FILL IN THE DISCLOSURE FORM. THESE FORMS ARE REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD, THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, AND THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE & OPERATIONS OF THE SCHOOL. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS ALSO REVIEWED WITH THE EMPLOYEES OF THE SCHOOL YEARLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD PRESIDENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING AND APPROVING THE COMPENSATION LEVEL OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING AND APPROVING COMPENSATION LEVELS FOR ALL OTHER STAFF.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
FINANCE COMMITTEE ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT.
